command

Command line processing functions

Functions
CommandProcess
unsigned char CommandProcess(
const COMMANDPARSER *CommandParsers,
unsigned char CommandParsersNum
)

Reads file_pri while data available or a command is received, then execute the command.

Returns
0

Nothing to process anymore

1

Something was processed

CommandGet

Reads file_pri until empty into the command buffer.

Afterwards, process the command buffer and identifies which command to run and returns.  If a message is received its ID is placed in msgid.

Returns
0

no message

1

message execution ok (message valid)

2

message execution error (message valid)

3

message invalid

CommandDecodeExec
unsigned char CommandDecodeExec(
const COMMANDPARSER *CommandParsers,
unsigned char CommandParsersNum,
char *buffer,
unsigned char size,
unsigned char *msgid
)

Identify which parser is appropriate and call it for decoding and execution.

Parameters
CommandParsers
const COMMANDPARSER*

Array of COMMANDPARSER

CommandParsersNum
unsigned char

Total number of available commands

buffer
char*

Buffer containing the command; must be null terminated

size
unsigned char

Size of the command in the buffer

msgid
unsigned char*

Returns the ID of the command, if a valid command was found

Returns
0

No message

1

Message execution ok (message valid)

2

Message execution error (message valid)

3

Message invalid

Parsers must return: 0 - Message execution ok (message valid) 1 - Message execution error (message valid) 2 - Message invalid

CommandSet
void CommandSet(
char *script,
unsigned char n
)

Sets a command (one or more, newline delimited) in the command buffer.  This can be used to set a command script to execute e.g. on startup.

Parameters
script
char*

command/script to copy in buffer

n
unsigned char

size of script; note that only up to COMMANDMAXSIZE bytes are copied in the command buffer.
